New Records: Adolis Garcia set a record for RBIs in a postseason series with 15.
Adolis Garcia's home run streak is tied for fourth-longest in postseason history.
Jose Altuve hit his 27th career postseason homer, two behind Manny Ramirez for most all-time.
Bruce Bochy became the first skipper to win a League Championship Series with three different teams.
Key Match Events: Adolis Garcia homered twice and drove in five runs.
Corey Seager hit a long home run in the first inning.
Nathaniel Lowe also hit a home run.
Evan Carter hit a two-run double.
Adolis Garcia hit a two-run single.
Adolis Garcia hit a solo home run in the eighth inning.
Jose Altuve hit a home run in the ninth inning.
Jordan Montgomery pitched 2 1/3 scoreless innings for the win.
Max Scherzer allowed four hits and two runs in 2 2/3 innings.
Cristian Javier was tagged for three runs and lifted with just one out in the first inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Corey Seager praised Adolis Garcia's performance despite being booed.
Bruce Bochy reflected on his return to managing and the team's resilience.
Dusty Baker acknowledged the Astros' defeat and reflected on their successful past seasons.
Adolis Garcia expressed gratitude towards his team for pushing him to play hard.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Texas Rangers reached their first World Series in 12 years.
The Rangers have gone 8-0 away from home in these playoffs, joining the 1996 Yankees as the only teams to win their first eight road games in one postseason.
The Rangers' win guaranteed a third all-wild card World Series, the first since Bochy's Giants beat Kansas City in 2014.
The Astros were dethroned as defending World Series champions.
The Astros' pitching staff got pounded for 20 runs in the final two games of the series.
